title: Ollie Sleightholme
text:
Oliver Harry Sleightholme (born 13 April 2000 in <a href="Northampton">Northampton</a>, <a href="England">England</a>) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer. He plays as a <a href="winger%20%28rugby%20union%29">winger</a> for <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton Saints</a>. His father, <a href="Jon%20Sleightholme">Jon Sleightholme</a>, was an <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England international</a>.
Youth career.
Sleightholme spent all his youth career at Northampton Old Scouts, where he played alongside future Saints teammate <a href="Connor%20Tupai">Connor Tupai</a>. He was a pupil at <a href="Northampton%20School%20for%20Boys">Northampton School for Boys</a>, and played in the school’s team that made it to the semi-final of the 2018 <a href="NatWest%20Schools%20Cup">NatWest Schools Cup</a>, in which he scored a try in a 19-12 defeat by <a href="Queen%20Elizabeth%20Grammar%20School%2C%20Wakefield">Queen Elizabeth Grammar School, Wakefield</a>. He played for the England <a href="rugby%20sevens">rugby sevens</a> team at the <a href="2017%20Commonwealth%20Youth%20Games">2017 Commonwealth Youth Games</a> in the <a href="The%20Bahamas">Bahamas</a>, and he scored a try in his team's loss to Samoa in <a href="Rugby%20sevens%20at%20the%202017%20Commonwealth%20Youth%20Games">the final</a>. He scored a try on his debut for <a href="England%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">England under-18s</a> in a 42-14 win against <a href="Wales%20national%20under-18%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales under-18s</a> on 25 March 2018.
Northampton Saints.
Sleightholme signed a senior academy contract with Northampton Saints before the 2018-19 season. He made his debut for Northampton in a <a href="Premiership%20Rugby%20Cup">Premiership Rugby Cup</a> match against <a href="Bristol%20Bears">Bristol Bears</a> on 27 October 2018. And he made his <a href="Premiership%20Rugby">Premiership</a> debut three weeks later, scoring his first Northampton try 14 seconds after coming on as a second-half replacement against <a href="Wasps%20RFC">Wasps</a>. In only his second <a href="European%20Rugby%20Challenge%20Cup">European Rugby Challenge Cup</a> game, he scored four tries against <a href="Timi%C8%99oara%20Saracens">Timișoara Saracens</a> on 18 January 2019.
England under-20s.
Sleightholme was named in the <a href="England%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">England squad</a> for the <a href="2019%20Six%20Nations%20Under%2020s%20Championship">2019 Six Nations Under 20s Championship</a>, and he made his debut in the opening game against <a href="Ireland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a>. He scored tries against both <a href="France%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a> and <a href="Italy%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a> to help England finish third in the competition.
Sleightholme also played at the <a href="2019%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Championship">2019 World Rugby Under 20 Championship</a>, and he scored two tries as England lost to Ireland in the opening game. He subsequently scored a try in England's final pool game against <a href="Australia%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a>, with England eventually finishing the tournament in fifth place.
<a href="Alan%20Dickens%20%28rugby%20union%29">Alan Dickens</a> named Sleightholme in his 32-man England squad for the <a href="2020%20Six%20Nations%20Under%2020s%20Championship">2020 Six Nations Under 20s Championship</a>.
England senior.
He was called up to the senior England squad in September 2021 for a training camp.
